Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town and Romantic Disillusionment
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting of 'Ghost Town' and the initial conflicts and desires of Nan and Cal, contrasted with the reality of the town's impending development.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Yearning and Rejection
sub_scenes.description: Nan expresses her dissatisfaction with 'Ghost Town' and rejects Cal's advances, revealing her romantic ideals are at odds with her current life.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Rejection and the Ghost Town Mystery

sub_scenes.title: Cal's Departure and Airport Revelation
sub_scenes.description: Cal departs, disillusioned. Meanwhile, new arrivals discuss plans to build an airport, revealing the true nature of 'Ghost Town' and shattering Nan's romantic view.

narrative_arcs.title: Cal's Frustrated Departure from Ghost Town
Arrival at Merrick Gulch and the 'Ghost Town' Label
Airport Development Plans for the Ghost Town
Nan's Distress and Realization of Ghost Town's Demolition

Major_Arcs.title: Reconciliation and Practicality vs. Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan and Cal's evolving relationship in light of the impending airport construction. Nan shifts from romantic ideals to practicality, while Cal grapples with disillusionment.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Apology and Practical Outlook
sub_scenes.description: Nan apologizes to Cal and attempts to reconcile by highlighting the practical benefits of the airport, signaling a shift in her perspective.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Apology and Practical View of the Airport

sub_scenes.title: Internal and External Conflicts
sub_scenes.description: Nan reflects on her harshness, while Cal expresses cynicism and disillusionment. Nan then faces unwanted advances from rough men, creating external conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Reflection on Her Harsh Reaction to Cal
Cal's Cynical Monologue on Love and Ghost Town
Confrontation with Rough Men and Nan's Resistance

Major_Arcs.title: Family Dynamics and Airport Acceptance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores Nan's interactions with her family regarding the airport, highlighting generational differences and Nan's emotional journey towards acceptance and romantic resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Practicality of Airport and Family Dismissal
sub_scenes.description: Rough men discuss the practical benefits of the airport. Nan's father dismisses her concerns, highlighting a generational gap in understanding.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Airport Frustration and Father's Dismissiveness
Horses for Construction and Father-Daughter Argument

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Breakdown and Parental Advice
sub_scenes.description: Nan breaks down emotionally, reflecting on her humiliation. Her parents and maid offer contrasting but supportive advice regarding her relationship with Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Humiliation and Reflection in Bed
Mother's Advice on Love and Childishness
Father's Pragmatic Advice to Focus on Cal
Maid's Reassurance of Cal's Love and Need for Patience

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Resolve and Pursuit of Cal
sub_scenes.description: Nan decides to take charge of her romantic situation, resolving to understand Cal's true feelings and actively pursuing him.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Resolve to Know Cal's True Feelings

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Duties and Father-Daughter Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces ranch-related responsibilities and further conflict between Nan and her father, highlighting business disagreements and personal tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Hand's Request and Father's Deal
sub_scenes.description: A ranch hand seeks Nan's help with horses. Nan then engages in a heated argument with her father about a business deal, showcasing their conflicting views.

narrative_arcs.title: Horses Arriving and Ranch Hand's Request for Help
Argument with Father About a Deal

Major_Arcs.title: Emotional Confession and Separation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Nan and Cal's emotional conversation, Cal's departure for work, and the ensuing time skip that tests their relationship.

sub_scenes.title: Confession and Departure
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal have a heartfelt conversation where Nan confesses her feelings and Cal explains his actions. He then departs for work, leading to a separation.

sub_scenes.title: Reunion and Belated Confession
sub_scenes.description: After a time skip marked by loneliness, Cal and Nan reunite, and Cal finally confesses his long-held feelings for her.

Major_Arcs.title: The Snowstorm Crisis and Community Response
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts the focus to a severe snowstorm that engulfs 'Ghost Town', creating a community crisis and testing relationships and resilience.

sub_scenes.title: Weather Report and Initial Concerns
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal discuss their relationship in a snowy setting. A weather report reveals a severe snowstorm, causing widespread concern and impacting daily life.

sub_scenes.title: Decision to Act and Arrival of Aid
sub_scenes.description: Cal decides to take action to address the crisis. Despair sets in, but hope arrives with a plane dropping fodder, signifying community resilience and external help.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: Arrival of the Plane

Major_Arcs.title: Introducing Chane Benson and Town Skepticism
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new character, Chane Benson, and the town's mixed reactions to his persona and actions, setting up a conflict around his reputation.

sub_scenes.title: The Cowboy's Confrontation and Bystander Reactions
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson confronts a man publicly, drawing shocked reactions from bystanders who express skepticism and mockery regarding his heroic image.

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Gun Obsession and Sally's Concern
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Jeff's fascination with guns and his sister Sally's growing concern about his behavior and potential influence from Chane Benson.

sub_scenes.title: Reminiscence and Growing Worry
sub_scenes.description: Sally reflects on Jeff's childhood hero-worship of their father and expresses her present concerns about his unhealthy obsession with guns.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Intervention
sub_scenes.description: Sally confronts Jeff about handling their father's gun. Clyde intervenes, reassuring Sally and planning to guide Jeff away from Chane Benson's influence.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to Mr. Benson and Ominous Warning
sub_scenes.description: Sally introduces Mr. Benson, who offers ominous advice and warnings about Chane Benson, highlighting his dangerous nature.

narrative_arcs.title: Ominous Advice and Mention of Violence

Major_Arcs.title: Public Outcry and Office Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the public reaction to Clyde's article about Chane Benson and the direct confrontation that ensues, escalating the conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Public Discussion and Article Revelation
sub_scenes.description: Townspeople discuss an article in the 'Juniper Clarion' that accuses Chane Benson of murder and calls for his expulsion, revealing public opinion.

narrative_arcs.title: Public Discussion about Chane Benson's Reputation and Article

sub_scenes.title: Office Confrontation and Sally's Warning
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson confronts Clyde in his office about the article, threatening him. Sally warns Clyde of the danger, but he dismisses her concerns, underestimating Benson's threat.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Warning in the Office

Major_Arcs.title: Escalation of Threats and Clyde's Defiance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers the intensification of threats against Clyde and his unwavering resolve to continue publishing articles exposing Chane Benson, despite the danger.

sub_scenes.title: Continued Threats and Sally's Plea
sub_scenes.description: The confrontation continues with escalating threats against Clyde. Sally desperately pleads with Clyde to stop provoking Benson, fearing for his life.

sub_scenes.title: Clyde's Resolve and Public Reaction
sub_scenes.description: Clyde remains determined to publish the truth despite the threats. Public reaction to his articles is shown, with some expressing shock and concern about inciting violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Determination to Publish Articles Despite Threats
Public Reaction to Clyde's Articles and Jeff's Insight

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Invitation and Awkward Dinner
sub_scenes.description: Mame and Jeff consider inviting Chane Benson to dinner as a diplomatic approach. The dinner itself is awkward, with Jeff behaving inappropriately under Benson's influence.

narrative_arcs.title: Considering a Dinner Invitation for Chane Benson
Awkward Dinner and Jeff's Demonstration for Chane

Major_Arcs.title: Deception and Confrontation with Chane Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the escalating tension surrounding Chane Benson through nighttime conversations and direct confrontations, revealing his manipulative nature and Sally's suspicions.

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Aftermath and Moonlit Conversation
sub_scenes.description: Jeff, Mame, and Chane are at dinner. Later, Chane and Sally have a moonlit conversation where Chane's flattery and hidden motives become apparent.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Accusation and Chane's Evasive Response
Escalating Accusations and Threat of Violence

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Confrontation with Jeff and Emotional Outburst
sub_scenes.description: Sally confronts Jeff, accusing him of betrayal and manipulation by Chane Benson, leading to an intense emotional outburst.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Confrontation with Jeff about Betrayal
Sally's Outburst and Accusation of Manipulation

Major_Arcs.title: Climax of Chane Benson Conflict and Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the climax of the Chane Benson storyline, featuring misunderstandings, threats, physical violence, and ultimately, Benson's departure and a resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Misunderstanding and Chane's Dominance
sub_scenes.description: Misunderstandings arise as Jeff and Sally discuss Chane. Chane asserts his dominance, creating a tense atmosphere.

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Reaction and Urgent Action
sub_scenes.description: Sally reacts emotionally to Chane's dominance and realizes the danger to Clyde. Urgent action is taken to save Clyde.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Danger and Urgent Action

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Benson's Exit
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson is confronted by townsmen and the editor. Flashbacks reveal the tense atmosphere before the confrontation. Benson is eventually forced to leave town.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with the Editor and Townsmen
Flashback to Clarion Office - The Ticking Clock
Flashback - Uncertainty and Fear Behind the Door
Reflection on Family, Courage, and Decency in Journalism

Major_Arcs.title: Introducing Steve Daley and Ranch Troubles
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Steve Daley and the escalating troubles faced by Betsy's ranch, setting up a Western conflict scenario.

sub_scenes.title: Arrival of Steve and Initial Tension
sub_scenes.description: A physical confrontation sets a tense tone. Steve Daley is introduced as the new 'boss' hired to help Betsy with ranch troubles, causing initial unease.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley to Betsy
Confirmation of Hiring and Foreshadowing Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Settling In and Ranch Conflict Explanation
sub_scenes.description: Steve settles in and arrangements are made for his accommodation. Betsy and Hank discuss Steve's character and the serious troubles plaguing the ranch, hinting at a range war.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Steve's Character and Past

Major_Arcs.title: Journey to Town and Confrontation with Fred Bridges
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Betsy and Steve's journey to town and their direct confrontation with antagonist Fred Bridges, leading to physical violence.

sub_scenes.title: Suspicion and Town Trip
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve travel to town. Betsy reflects on her lingering distrust of Steve. Hank gives orders, and Betsy questions his authority.

narrative_arcs.title: Journey to Town and Lingering Doubts
Leaving the Store and Betsy's Sarcasm

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Physical Fight
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve are confronted by Fred Bridges and his men in town, leading to verbal sparring and escalating into a physical altercation where Steve intervenes.

narrative_arcs.title: Aftermath of the Punch and Further Threat
Discussion on Gunfighters and Hornets' Nest

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy's Internal Conflict and Steve's Romantic Confession
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Betsy's internal conflict regarding Steve's gunfighter skills, her decision to fire him, her changing feelings, and Steve's romantic confession.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Realization and Firing Order
sub_scenes.description: Betsy reflects on Steve's gunfighting skills, realizing he's more than just a cowhand and initially orders Hank to fire him.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Feelings and Steve's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: Betsy admits her romantic feelings for Steve to Hank. Hank summons Steve, leading to a direct confrontation and romantic confession.

narrative_arcs.title: Hank's Understanding and Betsy's Romantic Feelings

Major_Arcs.title: Conflict of Profession and Love, and Romantic Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on the conflict between Steve's gunfighter profession and Betsy's desire for a peaceful life, culminating in a romantic resolution and commitment.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Inquiry and Steve's Confession
sub_scenes.description: Betsy questions Steve about his profession. Steve confesses his deep love for Betsy, leading to a romantic turning point.

sub_scenes.title: Ultimatum and Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: Betsy challenges Steve to give up his gun to prove his love. Steve agrees, and they share a kiss, resolving their romantic conflict.

Major_Arcs.title: Range War and Betsy's Stand
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts back to the ranch conflict with Old Man Bridges, escalating tensions and highlighting Betsy's determination to resolve the conflict without violence.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Old Man Bridges and Steve's Challenge
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges complains to Betsy and Hank, sparking accusations and escalating tensions. Steve challenges Hank, ready for violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Old Man Bridges' Complaint and Hank's Accusation
Betsy and Steve's Confrontation and Steve's Challenge to Hank
Betsy's Stand Against Gun Violence and Concern for Steve
Steve's Reflection on Past Mistakes and the Ambush

Major_Arcs.title: Action at Devil's Pass and Emotional Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc leads to a decisive action at Devil's Pass, resolving the range war conflict and culminating in a romantic reunion and future outlook for Betsy and Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Resolve and Ride to Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: Betsy resolves to act, arming herself and leading her men to Devil's Pass, anticipating a confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy and Steve's Parting and Betsy's Worried Reflection
Betsy's Command and Ride to Devil's Pass

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Romantic Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Betsy arrives at Devil's Pass. After fainting, she recovers and shares a romantic reunion with Steve, resolving their immediate conflict and solidifying their relationship with a hopeful future.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Ominous Recognition
Betsy's Recovery and Reassurance by Steve

Major_Arcs.title: Introducing Carrie and Dave's Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Carrie and Dave, setting up a new romantic conflict and range war scenario, distinct from the previous storylines.

sub_scenes.title: Argument to Protect Dave and Range Trouble
sub_scenes.description: A woman argues to protect 'Dave'. Curley arrives with news of ranchers encroaching on their range, initiating a new conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubled Arrival and Range Conflict

sub_scenes.title: Fence Explanation and Fred Gordon's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: The rancher explains the importance of fencing. Fred Gordon arrives with riders, escalating the range conflict with accusations about water access.

narrative_arcs.title: Explaining the Fence and Herd Concerns
Fred Gordon's Polite but Tense Arrival

Major_Arcs.title: Flashbacks, Conflicted Feelings, and Present Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc interweaves flashbacks to Carrie and Fred's past relationship with present-day confrontations and reveals Carrie's conflicted feelings.

sub_scenes.title: Flashback Apology and Carrie & Dave's Confession
sub_scenes.description: Flashback shows Carrie and her father apologizing to Fred. In the present, Carrie and Dave discuss their feelings about Fred, revealing Carrie's conflicted emotions.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie and Dave's Conflicted Feelings about Fred

sub_scenes.title: Present Confrontation and Accusation
sub_scenes.description: Returning to the present, Carrie is confronted by Fred Gordon, leading to accusations and Dave's intervention, escalating the love triangle drama.

narrative_arcs.title: Present Confrontation: Fred Gordon and Carrie
Carrie's Confession and Dave's Attempt to Reconcile

Major_Arcs.title: Betrayal and Confrontation over Carlton Contract
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Carrie's realization of Fred's deceit regarding the Carlton contract and her direct confrontation with him and Mr. Carlton, seeking justice.

sub_scenes.title: Fred's Contract-Driven Proposal and Carrie's Anger
sub_scenes.description: Fred reveals his contract-driven motivations, leading to Carrie's angry accusation of deceit and Dave's failed attempt to reconcile.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Carlton and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Mr. Carlton about the contract, seeking fairness. Mr. Carlton resolves the issue in Carrie's favor, leading to Fred's defeat and Carrie's emotional release.

narrative_arcs.title: Father's Wisdom on Love and Life

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie and Dave's Reconciliation and Carrie's True Love
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Carrie's reflection on her feelings, her encounter with Dave, and her ultimate realization and confession of love for Fred.

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Relief and Town Encounter
sub_scenes.description: Carrie reflects on her victory and encounters Dave in town, initiating a conversation about her feelings for Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Relief and Reflection on Fred

sub_scenes.title: Horseback Ride and Dave's Skepticism
sub_scenes.description: Carrie and Dave ride back from town, where Dave expresses disbelief at Carrie's denial of her feelings for Fred, perceiving her hidden love.

Major_Arcs.title: Reunion with Fred and Romantic Climax
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Carrie's emotional journey to reunite with Fred, leading to a heartfelt reconciliation and romantic climax, resolving their love story.

sub_scenes.title: Father's Dismissal and Misinterpretation
sub_scenes.description: Carrie expresses concern to her father, who dismisses her. Mr. Carlton's arrival leads to Carrie's initial misinterpretation about Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Mr. Carlton's Arrival and Carrie's Misinterpretation

sub_scenes.title: Revelation of Fred's Sacrifice and Reunion
sub_scenes.description: The truth about Fred's sacrifice and his brother's intervention is revealed, prompting Carrie's emotional awakening and her ride to Fred. They reunite and reconcile.

narrative_arcs.title: Revelation of Fred's Sacrifice and Brother's Intervention
Carrie's Emotional Awakening and Ride to Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Introducing Dirk and his Injury
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Dirk and the mystery surrounding his return and injury, shifting the narrative to a new set of characters and conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Cryptic Return and Injury Reveal
sub_scenes.description: Dirk returns unexpectedly, announcing he is 'done'. His sister later reveals he has been shot, introducing a new layer of conflict and mystery.

Major_Arcs.title: Investigation and Pursuit of Dirk
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on the investigation into Dirk's shooting and the Marshal's pursuit, setting up a law enforcement conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Dad's Concern and Marshal's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: Dirk's dad expresses concern and plans to investigate. Marshal Rance Cready arrives at the ranch, initiating his pursuit of Dirk.

narrative_arcs.title: Marshal Rance Cready's Arrival and Initial Inquiry
Confirmation of Pursuit and Denial of Dirk's Presence
Rance Cready's Insistence and Proof of Dirk's Presence

sub_scenes.title: Marshal's Compromise and Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: Marshal Cready finds Dirk injured and agrees to a delay for his recovery. Dirk and Chris attempt to escape, pursued by the Marshal.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Injured Dirk and Assertion of Law
Rejection of Excuse and Acknowledgment of Change

Major_Arcs.title: Romantic Confession and Escape Attempt
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc combines a romantic confession between Chris and Rance with the escalating escape attempt of Dirk and the Marshal's relentless pursuit.

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession and Escape Plan
sub_scenes.description: Chris and Rance confess their love amidst the Dirk situation. Chris proposes a plan to let Dirk escape, creating a moral dilemma for Rance.

narrative_arcs.title: Argument, Confession and Confirmation of Love
Rance's Internal Conflict and Realization of Misjudgment
Rance's Decision, Departure Announcement and Realization of Manipulation

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit and Violent Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and Chris attempt to escape, realizing they are being pursued. A violent confrontation ensues with shooting and injuries.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern about the Marshal and Reassurance
Realization of Pursuit and Urgent Escape
Argument on Handling the Injured Person

Major_Arcs.title: Aftermath of Violence and Romantic Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc concludes the Dirk and Rance storyline, focusing on the aftermath of the violent confrontation, Dirk's escape, Rance's recovery, and the romantic resolution between Rance and Chris culminating in a wedding proposal.

sub_scenes.title: Escape and Chris's Return
sub_scenes.description: Dirk escapes with help. Chris reflects on her love for Rance and returns to him, facing the consequences of her actions.

narrative_arcs.title: Forced Departure and Concern for the Injured
Woman's Reflection and Understanding of Love for Rance
Return to Rance and Confrontation about Injury

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Recovery and Wedding Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Rance recovers, expressing his love for Chris. Chris proposes marriage, leading to a romantic resolution and hopeful future.

narrative_arcs.title: Father's Departure and Hint at Private Matters
Expression of Gratitude and Love Confession

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Interruption and Dirk's Explanation
sub_scenes.description: Rance and Chris's wedding is dramatically interrupted by Dirk. Dirk arrives and offers a self-justifying explanation for his presence, leading to a final resolution about his character and past.

narrative_arcs.title: Rance's Reflections on Marriage and Dirk
